answers.answer: Hello,The bumps that you get after shaving are due to folliculitis. Folliculitis is the inflammation of one or more hair follicles. The condition may occur anywhere on the skin.Folliculitis starts when hair follicles are damaged by friction from clothing or blockage of the follicle. In most cases of folliculitis, the damaged follicles are then infected with the bacteria Staphylococcus (staph).Please keep the area clean and apply some topical antiseptics. Also wear loose-fitting cotton clothing and use an antibacterial soap or mild soap like dove.Avoid any kind of cosmetics. Topical antibiotics such as mupirocin or neomycin containing ointment are also useful.In case the symptoms persist then oral antibiotics may be needed.  Please consult a dermatologist in that case.Regarding the yeast infection, it is better to get a KOH examination of the skin scrapings done to confirm the diagnosis.I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: I am a 47 yr old female who has type 2 diabetes. Two years ago I was diagonosed with an underarm yeast infection due to high glucose levels.  I was given perscriptions from my physician and eventually my infection was cured.  Since that time I cannot wear any kind of deodorant.  I have tried many different kinds and cannot find anything that will not irritated my skin.  At night I use a zinc oxide cream to prevent irritation and during the day I use just a tiny bit at a time and have to apply it often.  This definitely does not help with odor.  Do you have any suggestions on what type of deodorant I could try?  I have tried baking soda, powders and a little of everything!  Also, when I shave under my arms, a couple of days later they are sore and have a few bumps underneath the skin that go away on their own.
title: underarm yeast infectiion
